alert.note: Alert for Tunica (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 12:17AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Lee, northeastern Phillips and west central Tunica Counties through 1245 AM CDT... At 1216 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northwest of Friars Point, or 10 miles southwest of Helena-West Helena, moving north at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
